intro: Ononis parviflora, commonly known as lesser whitlow grass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters and features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom from May to July. The plant has a fibrous root system and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Ononis parviflora is adapted to dry conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
